Function Documentation

void purify_measurement_cftadj ( void *  out,
void *  in,
void **  data 
)

Define adjoint measurement operator for continuos visibilities (currently includes adjoint continuos Fourier transform only).

Parameters:
[out]out(complex double*) Output image.
[in]in(complex double*) Input visibilities.
[in]data
  • data[0] (purify_measurement_cparam*): Parameters for the continuos Fourier transform.
  • data[1] (double*): Matrix with the deconvolution kernel in image space.
  • data[2] (purify_sparsemat_row*): The sparse matrix defining the convolution operator for the the interpolation.
  • data[3] (fftw_plan*): The complex-to-complex FFTW plan to use when computing the inverse Fourier transform (passed as an input so that the FFTW can be FFTW_MEASUREd beforehand).
  • data[4] (complex double*) Temporal memory for the zero padding.
Authors:
Rafael Carrillo

void *  in,
void **  data 
)

Compute forward Fouier transform of complex signal.

Parameters:
[out]out(complex double*) Forward Fourier transform of input signal.
[in]in(complex double*) Complex input signal.
[in]data
  • data[0] (fftw_plan*): The real-to-complex FFTW plan to use when computing the Fourier transform (passed as an input so that the FFTW can be FFTW_MEASUREd beforehand).
Authors:
Jason McEwen

Definition at line 127 of file purify_measurement.c.

void purify_measurement_fft_real ( void *  out,
void *  in,
void **  data 
)

Compute forward Fouier transform of real signal. A real-to-complex FFT is used (for speed optimisation) but the complex output signal is filled to its full size through conjugate symmetry.

Parameters:
[out]out(complex double*) Forward Fourier transform of input signal.
[in]in(double*) Real input signal.
[in]data
  • data[0] (fftw_plan*): The real-to-complex FFTW plan to use when computing the Fourier transform (passed as an input so that the FFTW can be FFTW_MEASUREd beforehand).
  • data[1] (purify_image*): The image defining the size of the Fourier transform.
Authors:
Jason McEwen

void purify_measurement_init_cft ( purify_sparsemat_row *  mat,
double *  deconv,
double *  u,
double *  v,
purify_measurement_cparam *  param 
)

Initialization for the continuos Fourier transform operator.

Parameters:
[out]mat(purify_sparsemat_row*) Sparse matrix containing the interpolation kernels for each visibility. The matrix is stored in compressed row storage format.
[out]deconv(double*) Deconvolution kernel in real space
[in]u(double*) u coodinates between -pi and pi
[in]v(double*) v coodinates between -pi and pi
[in]paramstructure storing information for the operator
Authors:
Rafael Carrillo

void purify_measurement_opfwd ( void *  out,
void *  in,
void **  data 
)

Define measurement operator (currently includes Fourier transform and masking only).

Parameters:
[out]out(complex double*) Measured visibilities.
[in]in(double*) Real input image.
[in]data
  • data[0] (fftw_plan*): The real-to-complex FFTW plan to use when computing the Fourier transform (passed as an input so that the FFTW can be FFTW_MEASUREd beforehand).
  • data[1] (purify_image*): The image defining the size of the Fourier transform.
  • data[2] (purify_sparsemat*): The sparse matrix defining the masking operator.
Authors:
Jason McEwen

void **  A_data,

void **  At_data 
)

Power method to compute the norm of the operator A.

Return values:
boundupper bound on norm of the continuos Fourier transform operator (double).
Parameters:
[in]APointer to the measurement operator.
[in]A_dataData structure associated to A.
[in]AtPointer to the the adjoint of the measurement operator.
[in]At_dataData structure associated to At.

void purify_measurement_symcftadj ( void *  out,
void *  in,
void **  data 
)

Define adjoint measurement operator for continuos visibilities It takes advantage of signal reality and conjugate symmetry. (currently includes adjoint continuos Fourier transform only).

Parameters:
[out]out(complex double*) Output image. Imaginary part set to zero.
[in]in(complex double*) Input visibilities.
[in]data
  • data[0] (purify_measurement_cparam*): Parameters for the continuos Fourier transform.
  • data[1] (double*): Matrix with the deconvolution kernel in image space.
  • data[2] (purify_sparsemat_row*): The sparse matrix defining the convolution operator for the the interpolation.
  • data[3] (fftw_plan*): The complex-to-complex FFTW plan to use when computing the inverse Fourier transform (passed as an input so that the FFTW can be FFTW_MEASUREd beforehand).
  • data[4] (complex double*) Temporal memory for the zero padding.
Authors:
Rafael Carrillo

Definition at line 1015 of file purify_measurement.c.

References purify_measurement_cparam::nx1, purify_measurement_cparam::ny1, and purify_measurement_cftadj().

void purify_measurement_symcftfwd ( void *  out,
void *  in,
void **  data 
)

Define forward measurement operator for continuos visibilities It takes advantage of signal reality and conjugate symmetry. (currently includes adjoint continuos Fourier transform only).

Parameters:
[out]out(complex double*) Output visibilities.
[in]in(complex double*) Input image. Assumed real. Imaginary part set to zero.
[in]data
  • data[0] (purify_measurement_cparam*): Parameters for the continuos Fourier transform.
  • data[1] (double*): Matrix with the deconvolution kernel in image space.
  • data[2] (purify_sparsemat_row*): The sparse matrix defining the convolution operator for the the interpolation.
  • data[3] (fftw_plan*): The complex-to-complex FFTW plan to use when computing the inverse Fourier transform (passed as an input so that the FFTW can be FFTW_MEASUREd beforehand).
  • data[4] (complex double*) Temporal memory for the zero padding.
Authors:
Rafael Carrillo
